newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish parties' ratings in opinion polls.
newsitem.headline: Polish parties' ratings in opinion polls.

text.p: A survey by the public CBOS polling institute published on Friday showed the Solidarity Electoral Action (AWS) holding on to first place with runner-up Democratic Left Alliance (SLD) narrowing the gap.
Following is a ranking of Polish political parties according to five most recent public opinion polls.
Parliamentary elections are due around September, 1997.
CBOS PBS OBOP DEMOSKOP CBOS
NOTE - Party names: AWS - The Solidarity Electoral Action, an opposition electoral bloc of more than 30 small right-wing parties led by the Solidarity trade union.
SLD - the Democratic Left Alliance, the ex-communist group and the larger partner in the ruling leftist coalition.
PSL - The Polish Peasant Party, the smaller partner in the government coalition UW - The Union for Freedom, a right-centrist group, the biggest opposition party in parliament.
ROP - The Movement for Reconstruction of Poland, a non-parliamentary group, advocating patriotic, anti-communist and often populist values.
UP - The Union of Labour, a leftist opposition party.
Polling agencies: CBOS - public, Poland's biggest polling institution.
OBOP - controlled by the state-owned television.
DEMOSKOP - private.
PBS - private, preparing polls for authoritative Rzeczpospolita daily.
-- Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
